titleproper.value: Guide to the William Bush Baer Papers <num>MC.46</num>

author.value: Collection processed by University Archives staff. Electronic finding aid prepared by John Bence in 2011.

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-12-04T14:11:53</date>

extent.value: in 1 manuscript box, and 1 half manuscript box.

abstract.value:
William Bush Baer was an instructor in English at the New York University College of Arts and Sciences in 1926, and was eventually promoted to dean in January of 1942. Beginning in 1952, Dean Baer wrote, produced, and performed in the 15-minute, Sunday morning television program called "Our Goodly Heritage" on WCBS-TV. 

The collection consists of materials related to Baer's telecasted educational program "Our Goodly Heritage", and materials Baer created and gathered while working at New York University. Collection materials include correspondence, press releases, news clippings, and typescripts. Materials date from 1944 to 1958.

p.value: Identification of item, date; William Bush Baer Papers; MC 46; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.
Donated by the Green Room Honor Society at an unknown date. There is no accession record associated with this collection.

Beginning in 1952, Dean Baer wrote, produced, and performed in the 15-minute, Sunday morning television program called "Our Goodly Heritage" on WCBS-TV. The series was patterned after Baer's course on the Bible as literature.

The bulk of this collection consists of materials related to Baer's telecasted educational program on WCBS-TV called "Our Goodly Heritage." To a lesser extent, the collection contains materials Baer created and gathered while working at New York University. Collection materials include correspondence, press releases, news clippings, and typescripts. Materials date from 1944 to 1958.
